definitions.definition: a written message from one person to another, usually put in an envelope and sent by post:
examples: I got a letter from the bank this morning.

definitions.definition: any of the set of symbols used to write a language, representing a sound in the language:
the exact words of the law and not its more important general meaning
used to refer to a standard size of paper in the US, 8.5 inches by 11 inches:
examples: Fliers are usually printed either on letter size or legal size paper.
